raw_text: "As someone new to the gym, I find the equipment confusing. I’m trying to get better, but I’m only able to go once a week, and I feel like it’s not enough. I wish the gym had more beginner-friendly training sessions."
"I only go twice a week due to work, but it’s hard to find time for the gym. The weekend classes are always fully booked, which is frustrating. I just want a chance to work out when I have the time."

"I’ve just started, and I’m already struggling to keep up. The cardio machines are good, but I can’t seem to get the hang of the weight training. I’ve heard a lot of people talk about the trainers helping, but I haven’t had a chance to ask for help yet."

"I’m trying to make progress, but I’m stuck in a routine. I’m only able to go three times a week due to my schedule. The gym hours don’t work well for me, especially on weekends when I have time but the gym opens late."
"I only go to the gym once a week, so I try to make the most out of it. I love the HIIT classes, but I wish they were longer. It feels like I only get warmed up when the class ends."
"I work a 9 to 5 job, and it’s hard to get to the gym before closing time. I feel like I miss out on classes I want to take. They should extend the hours, or at least open earlier on weekends."
"I used to go every day, but now I can only make it 4 times a week. I feel like I’m losing progress, and the weekend hours are not ideal. Why does it open so late on Saturdays?"
"As an intermediate trainee, I love the variety of equipment at this gym. But the weekends are always so crowded, and I can’t get a decent workout in because of the wait times."

"I train 5 times a week, but sometimes I feel like the gym is too crowded. Especially when I get in after work, I can’t use the machines I want. I’d love to see a membership cap to avoid overcrowding."
"I just want to do cardio, but the machines are always taken after work. I wish the gym would add more cardio machines or maybe extend the hours to accommodate people who work 9-5 jobs."
"I work a lot and can only make it to the gym once a week, but I can’t stand the weekend rush. The gym needs better crowd management or extended weekend hours."

"I go to the gym 4 times a week, and I love the results I’m getting. The only issue is the space—it’s cramped, and sometimes I have to wait a while for machines. Maybe they could use more space for free weights."

"I’ve been going 3 times a week, but the gym’s open hours are a hassle. I have to work late most days, and by the time I get there, the gym is closed. I really wish they would extend the hours on weekdays."
"I just want to go to the gym on weekends, but every time I try to book a class, it’s full! It’s frustrating when you have a limited window of time to train."

"I’ve been training for a while now and go about 3 times a week. The gym is great for the most part, but the showers could be cleaner. Sometimes there’s not enough space for everyone, and I don’t like waiting."
"The gym’s got everything I need, but I work 9 to 5 and can only get in after work. The gym hours are way too short, and the weekends are always busy with no extra classes."
"As someone who works long hours, I can only train on weekends. The weekend hours are terrible though, with the gym opening too late, and there’s no good class schedule."
"The gym is beginner-friendly, but the machines are confusing to use, and the staff is rarely available to help."
"I love the free introductory session, but the gym is too crowded in the evenings, and the lockers are too small."
"The gym is clean and well-lit, but the treadmills are outdated, and the music is too loud for my taste."
"The gym has a great variety of machines, but the dumbbells are often misplaced, and the showers are too small."
"The group classes are fun and challenging, but the yoga mats are worn out, and the showers are often out of hot water."
"I love the gym's app for tracking my progress, but the leg press machine is broken, and the smoothie bar is overpriced."
"The Olympic lifting platforms are solid, but the gym needs more heavy dumbbells, and the chalk dispensers are always empty."
"The cryotherapy chamber is a game-changer for recovery, but the gym's Wi-Fi is unreliable, and the parking lot is too small."
"The advanced powerlifting classes are fantastic, but the barbells are rusty, and the gym's music playlist is repetitive."
